intro: Weinmannia madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar weinmannia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Weinmannia madagascariensis is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat and is often found in moist, forested areas.
